Disposition of Request: Informed the requester that the FOIA does not apply to state or local records; Provided requester with contact information for the North Carolina Judicial Standards Commission, as well as for the North Carolina Administrative Office of the Courts

Summary of Request: Copy of “the document that identifies the Act of Congress that gives the Department of Justice . . . the authority to supervise, monitor and/or keep anyone in custody subject to supervised release after serving their prison sentence.”

Summary of Request: Records on certain individuals/attorneys working for and in the commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Disposition of Request: Informed requester that the FOIA does not apply to state or local records, or records of non-governmental organizations; Provided requester with contact information for the Office of Open Records for the commonwealth of Pennsylvania, the American Bar Association, and the Pennsylvania Bar Association

Summary of Request: Records on “planned or anticipated organized responsive actions/activities to be taken by the government of the United States” in response to protests or revolt by citizens of the United States
Disposition of Request: Provided requester with links to the DOJ FOIA Reference Guide on the OIP website, and to information on FOIA.gov on how the FOIA works across the federal government

Summary of Request: Copies of the oaths of office, “statement[s] of Appointed or Elected Official (Anti-Bribery Statement)," and bonds for U.S. District Court Judge Martin Reidinger, U.S. Magistrate Judge Dennis Howell, two U.S. District Court Clerks, and Assistant U.S. Attorney Thomas Kent
Disposition of Request: Partial Grant/Partial Denial/Partial No Records: Informed requester that federal judges are not bonded; Also informed requester that OLP does not maintain records on Magistrate Judges or administrative personnel of the federal court system, and that records of the federal judiciary (though not subject to the FOIA) are maintained by the Administrative Office of the United States Courts, and provided contact information for the office should requester wish to request additional information; Also determined that the Executive Office for United States Attorneys, DOJ, was also an appropriate entity for handling and referred requester to that component for processing
Description of Exemption(s) (if applicab: Information the release of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of the personal privacy of a third party

Summary of Request: Copy of “the document(s) identifying the Act of Congress [which] authorizes the Commission to issue warrants.”
